articles.title: Film show on Russian National Day
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il enjoys comedy
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed with servicemen of KPA unit no. 2620 a performance given by artistes of the KPA April 25 Film Studio who returned from a performance tour.
   The artistes gave performances of the comedy "Letter" in Hamhung, Chongjin and Songrim cities and other areas, contributing to encouraging party members and other working people to the forced march for the final victory. The comedy successfully shows the great vitality of the revolutionary spirit of soldiers and the idea of army-people unity.
   They reported to General Kim Jong Il that they returned after successfully making a performance tour and performed the comedy again.
   He congratulated the actors and actresses on their successful performance and gave thanks to them for the tremendous achievements they made by giving performances for working people of various social strata as intended by the party.    
   He said they displayed an admirable fighting spirit during the performance tour and that it is an expression of noble political and ideological traits possessed only by the artistes of the KPA.
   He also said the creators and artistes of the film studio should continue taking the lead in educating servicemen and people in a revolutionary manner, deeply aware of their mission and duty as vanguards of the ideological front. He then specified important tasks for invigorating the revolutionary creative and artistic activities.

articles.title: Unionist excursion to Jong Il Peak
articles.content:
Film show on Russian National Day
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- A film show was held in Pyongyang on June 10 to mark the National Day of Russia.
   Invited were Russian ambassador to Korea Valery Denisov and embassy officials.
   Present were vice-chairman of the Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea Ro Sok Gyu, who is chairman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association,  and other officials concerned and working people in the city.
   After looking round photographs introducing Russia, the participants saw a  Russian feature film.

articles.title: Papers on just struggle of Libyan people
articles.content:
Unionist excursion to Jong Il Peak
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Some 400 officials of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and model union members across the country made an excursion to Jong Il Peak from June 4 to 9 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of General Kim Jong Il's opening of the road of excursions  to Mt. Paektu revolutioanry battle sites.
   The excursion helped them to prepare themselves as  revolutionaries of Juche type who live, work and fight in the spirit of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Statement of NDFSK spokesman
articles.content:
Papers on just struggle of Libyan people
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The Korean people extend full support and firm solidarity to the Libyan people in their just struggle to defend the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of their country, say Pyongyang-based papers today in signed articles dedicated to the 28th anniversary of the abolition of a U.S. military base in Libya.
   The author of a Rodong Sinmun article says:
   The imperialists, regarding Libya as a thorn in their side for its anti-imperialist independent stand, have persistently tried to make the Libyan people shrink from the road of their own choice.
   With no isolation and suffocation moves, however, can they break the will of the Libyan people.
   The Libyan people, convinced of the validity of their cause, are dynamically advancing along the road of their own choice under the guidance of colonel Moammer El Gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution, repulsing the anti-Libyan moves of the imperialists.
   A signed article of Minju Joson says that the recent victory of the Libyan people in confrontation with the imperialists over the "lockerbie incident" clearly demonstrates their unbreakable anti-imperialist independent stand and will.

articles.title: S. Korea continues purchasing weapons from U.S.
articles.content:
Statement of NDFSK spokesman
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) in a statement published on June 9 on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the June popular resistance urged the patriotic-minded South Korean people from all walks of life to preserve the valuable experience of the resistance and fight united as one, the Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation reported.
   He said that the June resistance involving more than 5 million people of different social standings was recorded as one more brilliant chapter in the history of anti-American, anti-dictatorial patriotic movement.
   Referring to the despicable flunkeyist act of the present ruling forces, he further said:
   This treacherous act is a mockery of the June popular resistance.
   The national democratic forces with the working people  at the head should wage a powerful struggle for the abrogation of the evil labour law and "National Security Law", the dissolution of the "Agency for National Security Planning" and the release of prisoners of conscience and thus drive  the "people's government" out of power.
   They also should develop the anti-government democratic struggle into an anti-American, anti-outsider independent struggle to put an end to the U.S. colonial domination and interference and to the trusteeship of the International Monetary Fund and, at the same time, launch a nationwide movement for independence and reunification.

articles.title: "Constitutional amendment" likely to spark discord in S. Korea
articles.content:
S. Korea continues purchasing weapons from U.S. 
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The South Korean regime made a contract with the United States to purchase dlrs 8.2 billion worth of weapons and has imported F-16s, harpoon missiles, multiple rockets launchers, etc. From the United States on a stage-by-stage basis, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   Now the regime owes the United States dlrs 1,370 million in arms deal. The United States wants South Korea to pay off the debt within two years.
   The arms purchase by the puppet regime is an anti-nation act showing how frantic it is in war preparations against the north.

articles.title: Rent of U.S. embassy ground not paid
articles.content:
"Constitutional amendment" likely to spark discord in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yun Hwan, vice-president of the South Korean opposition "Grand National Party," told a press conference on June 8 that the agreement between the "National Congress for New Politics" and the "United Liberal Democrats" on "constitutional amendment for cabinet system" which led to the establishment of the coalition "government" is unlikely to be implemented, a Seoul-based radio said.
   If the coalition "government" brings forward "constitutional amendment" again, it will be confronted with objection of the "GNP," he added.
   His remark indicates that the issue will spark a fresh strife in the South Korean political camp.
   The ruler of South Korea, in the hope of defeating the candidate of the then ruling party in the "Presidential Election" in December last year, joined hands with the "ULD," promising Kim Jong Pil, a "Yusin" remnant, to revise the "constitution" for cabinet system in the middle of his term if he came to power.
   The "GNP" objection will be favorable to the ruler, who is seeking to monopolize power.
   At a recent press conference, Kim Jong Pil contended that a political reform for "cabinet system" based on the "multi-party structure" should be carried out because things are not going well under the present system. His remark is apparently a token of discontent with the ruler, who may break his promise.

articles.title: Inventions and new technology exhibition
articles.content:
Rent of U.S. embassy ground not paid
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The U.S. have not paid the rent of their embassy ground of over 2,000 Phyong  in Sejongro, Seoul, a report said.
   The United States did not pay the rent for nearly 40 years after it set up its embassy, a local tool of colonial rule.
    Therefore, the South Korean puppets suffer a loss of an estimated 14 billion won every year.

articles.title: Japanese authorities' abuses of DPRK denounced
articles.content:
Inventions and new technology exhibition
   Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The fifth national inventions and new technology exhibition is going on at the three-revolution exhibition in the capital city of Pyongyang.                                                  
   On display at the exhibition hall are more than 5,000 items of inventions and new technology of high value of some 2,500 kinds in life size, model, picture, sand table, diagram and video tape.                                      
   Director sin won chan of the invention and patent promotion department of the invention office of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea said the inventions on display are of weighty importance in the nation's economic development and the improvement of the people's living standards.                                                   
   Among the exhibits from the ministry of coal industry are  advanced blowing and coal-cutting methods and a new excavating machine.                                          
   Those are now in wide use at coal mine pits.              
   A technology of drastically increasing the adaptability through the combination of transformers different in volume and features and turbines of new type from the power industrial domain are of high value in production of electricity and the building of minor power stations.        
   A new method of heating coking battery, a new progress of making steel and other research results from the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and the Chollima Steel Complex under the Ministry of Metal Industry are inventions helpful to the development of the nation's metal industry.           
   Various kinds of catalyzers needed for production of fertilizers, high-pressure pump, bulb and pump wings  of  air-condensers and other inventions for modernisation and scientification of fertilizer production are exhibits from the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex.                      
   Also on display are a new specimen of rice and different biofertilizers, including new agricultural chemicals, which are of importance in agricultural production.                
   The inventions and new technology presented draw the close attention of people for their dependence on local raw materials and technology.

articles.title: Greetings to Russian President
articles.content:
Japanese authorities' abuses of DPRK denounced
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea was interviewed by KCNA today over the results of search for Japanese missing persons made public by the DPRK Red Cross Society recently.
   The spokesman said:
   From the humanitarian point of view, the Red Cross Society carried out a searching operation with sincerity for five months, taking into account Japan's request for information as to whether there are Japanese missing persons in the DPRK or not.
   The results of the searching operation, however, prove that none of the Japanese missing persons  has been in the DPRK.
   Asked by the Red Cross Society, authoritative government organs of the DPRK carried out the searching operation in a responsible way in cooperation with it. The Japanese government was officially informed of the results of search through an appropriate channel.
   Originally, Japan attempted to charge the DPRK with being "kidnapper" by raising outcries over the "suspected kidnapping" of Japanese persons by the DPRK.
   But it is real kidnappings that the Japanese imperialists took millions of Koreans to Japan before the liberation of Korea and Kim Dae Jung was abducted in Tokyo in the '70s.
   Japan, which is recognized as a perpetrator by history and the international community, gravely insulted the DPRK's sovereignty and dignity with outcries over "kidnapping" in a bid to paint itself as a victim. Its hostile act can never be tolerated.
   Though the Japanese authorities cancelled the word of "suspected kidnapping" and requested the DPRK to find out missing persons, the results of search finally prove that their missing has nothing to do with the DPRK, either.
   As we have stated, the normalization of DPRK-Japan diplomatic relations and food assistance are not compulsory. 
   It is a legitimate right of the Korean people to make Japan compensate for its past crimes and it is the unswerving will of the DPRK government to exercise the right by all means.
